message.content:
cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.CL, cs.CY, cs.CR

The paper proposes a novel search-driven framework for acquiring scientific documents, which involves using publicly-available research paper titles and author names as queries to a web search engine. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category. Additionally, the paper focuses on acquiring documents for scientific portals, which suggests that it may also belong to the Digital Libraries (cs.DL) sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of accurate classification modules, which suggests that it may belong to the Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) sub-category. The paper may also belong to the Cybersecurity (cs.CY) sub-category, as it discusses the acquisition of documents through web search engines, which may involve considerations of security and privacy. Finally, the paper may belong to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category, as it may involve considerations of securing the acquired documents and ensuring their authenticity.
